eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: As he hears the Sovereigns of Beasts, Zhubayr finds that they have been awaiting his return. Lazvar also offers him another gem. Now, he recalls his identity and his duty as an attendant general to the Shah charged with guarding the Shah's glorious treasures.

attributes.content: It seems that Zubayr broke the window... and left on his own?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I'll go find him and bring him back.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Leave it to the museum, Pepe. You haven't had a proper rest for several days now.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: The envoy from the City of Gold is about to reach my father's territory, Anat. I need every second I can get.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You and Titi have gone through a lot tidying up the damage to the museum. I suspect there are a few spots Zubayr might be. I'll go check them out right away.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Do you know why I didn't want to lend you Zubayr at first, Pepe? After I got your letter saying you were coming back, I wanted to tell you...
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Two months ago, I was on a business trip in your father's domain. There, I saw that the envoy from the City of Gold had already arrived.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Your brother's already gone to the City.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You knew, but you never told me.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You were so happy in your letter telling me what you found. You even used twenty exclamation marks in a row at one point.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I... I didn't have the heart to tell you.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Then why'd you lend him to me? You got me excited over nothing...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: This is a city of jewels, Pepe! There's just so many gems here that I thought you'd never find the ones you were looking for!
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I thought you might give up on your own, when the time came.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: B-But the envoy was supposed to arrive in August, right? Why were they ahead of schedule?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Your father wrote a letter requesting they come in advance.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: So they already decided a long time ago. They just didn't want me to kick up a fuss, so they waited until I was out looking for artifacts of the Shah before sending the kid off to the City of Gold.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But He told me he would wait to see my discovery before making his decision...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The elders always make their own decisions, Pepe. Nothing us can do about it.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Did you see the brat too?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: He must be real happy with himself, getting to go to the City of Gold. I don't know how many times we've fought in public or in private.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I don't think he was particularly happy about it, Pepe. From what I could see, he looked like he's been hiding some sadness this whole time.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: He called me to the study that day, saying that it was unlikely the two of you would meet again in your lifetimes, and that he hoped that I could pass a few words on to you.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: What did he say?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: He said he hopes you will remember his voice. After that, he left.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: He didn't have much luggage on him, and only a portion of it was his. Everything else had to do with you and your father.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Pepe...?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Ever since I was little, everyone would tell me how becoming the Shahanshah's historian would continue my family's honorable legacy. But honor is usually bought with sacrifice and devotion, Anat.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Entering the City of Gold and becoming the historian means never leaving ever again, never to see your friends or family. All that comes with you is your scrolls and books.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But... you really hate being chained to a desk, don't you, Pepe?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Yep. I wanted to spend my entire life walking across Sargon, free to look for every remnant and vestige left behind by history.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But I couldn't do all that... because I couldn't let the boy get what he wanted.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Is it so tough for you to let your brother get his way that you'd rather be unhappy yourself?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Ever since we were little, everyone who saw him would praise him as a quiet yet cool-headed boy, perfect historian material.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I was the only one who knew how bad he was, and that he loved fooling around. Making him sit in front of a table for more than a second was torture for him.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Then why did the two of you fight over the position of court historian?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Because he didn't want me to go to the City of Gold.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: He didn't want me stuck there by myself.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: So you...?
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: I'm kinda the same...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I don't want him to be stuck there by himself either.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: A gem that would bring relief to sore legs after standing for too long? No, I have no need of it.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: A gem that would cause the other party to apologize of their own accord? Of some use, but also not what I seek.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: I can sense that the gem is extremely close, but there are far, far too many jewels in this house...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Hearing footsteps coming from the corridor, Zubayr immediately hurries back to the huge gilded box to lie down.
He senses an attentive gaze falling upon him, yet not a word breaks the silence. He cautiously opens his eyes a silver—
And sees a sand-colored animal.
Oh... This cannot be...
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: The creature jumps into the gilded box, bringing its face right up against Zubayr's mask, as if lightly sniffing him.
A sable beast also sticks its head into the box.
Mio... Woof...?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Seems your memory's nearly back to normal.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Mhm. The scent does not lie. You are no fake.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Shut it, Woof.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: How did you two become so small...?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Aren't we the way we are now because you failed in your duties as a retainer?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: My duties...?
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: If I still looked as I did back then, I'd be carried out to parade every day. How would I have time to help you find gems, then?
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: It's better for all of us the way I am now.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Mio, Zubayr has no way of understanding what we're talking about right now.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: I already warned you of this before he arrived.
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: (Angry glare) Hmph...
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: (Guiltily looks away)
attributes.name: Woof

attributes.content: Never mind. He'll soon understand what we experienced these past three hundred years.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: Woof, call over our new retainer.
attributes.name: Mio

attributes.content: The young overseer walks through a near-endless hallway to reach Zubayr.
A blue fowlbeast suddenly flies atop the wall of the trading post, prodding at a mechanism inlaid within.
Gears mesh together and springs creak, and the fowlbeast plucks a gemstone out of the safe that just opened.
It places the stone on a thick brown piece of velvet on a tray, presenting it to the overseer.
His gaze is calm. His gaze is impassioned.
I am pleased to meet you, Zubayr Effendi... No. Rather, long time no see.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: This stone is one of my weights.
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: In addition to this gem trading post, there are also all the jewels circulating through the Grand Bazaar...
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: I would like to know, Zubayr Effendi, if all these gems together would outweigh the soul of a sinner?
attributes.name: Lazvar

attributes.content: The door's unlocked, come in.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: I said come in, did I not?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Is that you, Narantuya?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: There is no-one in the black of night outside, but the rapping on the door continues.
Aspasia looks up and sees a construct of exceedingly ancient make clinging to the top of the door.
The gyrating construct beats on the jewels embedded into the door with all speed, shaking out grains of sand from who-knows-where.
A new form of robbery...?
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: As Aspasia stretches out her hand to take it down from its perch, it drops the door ornament it was holding onto the ground.
The gem glimmers for a moment in the darkness. Soon after, Aspasia sees the gem and the construct disappear into the entrance to the sewer.
Jewels snatching away a jewel.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: Good. Merely gems retrieving their compatriots from the clutches of their excavators.
attributes.name: Aspasia

attributes.content: To history!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: To the dead!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: To our dear Narantuya!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Even though she's not here!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: But she's the one who treated us to all this carob juice!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: I never knew a mummy could be that valuable. How about we go check out the museum storehouses tomorrow and see if we can scrounge up another dead guy?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Oh, Ajazi, Ajazi, ye of little thought. Only looking for the dead in the museum? Can't you see the big picture here?
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: We need to go look for dead people outside the museum too!
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Yeah, you're right.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: But wouldn't we become officers of the law if we did that?
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: ...Did you lose something, Ajazi? I feel like you're not your usual self.
attributes.name: Ajani

attributes.content: Eh? No, definitely haven't lost anything here. A great bandit like me wouldn't let anything of mine get stolen.
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: Now shut up already and keep drinking!
attributes.name: Ajazi

attributes.content: I thank you, young one.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: Those metal creations who accompanied me have returned... as has my duty.
attributes.name: Zubayr

attributes.content: You and I have gone into the night, awake and alert. Now, the sun rises once more.
attributes.name: Zubayr
